html:
Here are a few resources to help you get started.

 

Welcome to MongoDB !

 

Ready to get your first MongoDB cluster up and running? Start with these four steps:

  1. Create cluster
  2. Add IP address to access list
  3. Create a user
  4. Connect to cluster

 

 

We’ve also put together a six-minute video that guides you through cluster setup.

Next, start building by adding data to your newly created cluster. Use one of our sample datasets for quick prototyping, generate mock data, or import your own data to get started.

Get started

New to MongoDB?

 

If you’re experienced with relational databases, transitioning to MongoDB’s document model may feel like a shift—but it’s one designed for flexibility and performance at scale.

 

Once you've completed the above steps to get started, review our SQL to MongoDB mapping chart to see how common relational concepts translate to MongoDB (e.g. tables → collections). Then, explore MongoDB Skills for short, 60–90 minute mini-courses to quickly build your knowledge.

Copyright © 2025 MongoDB, All rights reserved.
1633 Broadway Floor 38, New York, NY 10019
view in browser or unsubscribe
text:
Here are a few resources to help you get started. 







Welcome to MongoDB !




Ready to get your first MongoDB cluster up and running? Start with these four 
steps:

 * Create cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/deploy-free-tier-cluster/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
 * Add IP address to access list 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/security/add-ip-address-to-list/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
 * Create a user 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/create-mongodb-user-for-cluster/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
 * Connect to cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/connect-to-your-cluster/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>



 

We’ve also put together a six-minute video 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
 that guides you through cluster setup.

 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>

Next, start building by adding data to your newly created cluster. Use one of 
our sample datasets for quick prototyping,generate mock data 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/synthetic-data?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
, orimport your own data 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/import?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
 to get started. 



Get started  
<https://account.mongodb.com/account/login?n=https%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fgo%3Fl%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fv2%2F%3Cproject%3E%26h%3Dclusters%2Fdetail%2F%3Ccluster%3E>



New to MongoDB?




If you’re experienced with relational databases, transitioning to MongoDB’s 
document model may feel like a shift—but it’s one designed for flexibility and 
performance at scale.



Once you've completed the above steps to get started, review our SQL to 
MongoDB mapping chart 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/sql-comparison/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
 to see how common relational concepts translate to MongoDB (e.g. tables → 
collections). Then, exploreMongoDB Skills 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/skills?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
 for short, 60–90 minute mini-courses to quickly build your knowledge. 








 <https://www.linkedin.com/company/mongodbinc/>  <https://twitter.com/mongodb> 
 <https://youtube.com/user/mongodb>  <https://www.instagram.com/mongodb>  
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/> 

Copyright © 2025 MongoDB, All rights reserved.
1633 Broadway Floor 38, New York, NY 10019
view in browser 
<https://email.mongodb.com/s/vb/G4sGNCM8PF5zNkrzgbPHf2ZiRgTNEZgCOtBk57urkKfNjBiVMpa5lXqYJG8mX8UlKmaGRKvwLlzGx175GRISK6onUQSE7eN9107d__TFwDx0D3c9y9HHEzSF_zypXqdMX33x_WHIVsBwK97YEkV_fWEEpg/4iFOk-PTmO1A1-F2WAPT7RNBe_fZCDXW/9>
 orunsubscribe 
<https://email.mongodb.com/s/eh/Ffx1P1KCpxSRF5i9IkUCVJ6RUJ9LIBA62LkyoZFcWMbKLI31Ui8Krlr7Rcc0jb7fnpih30p5mJ0ZHoVOJnyt1SFHc1KaIdk4JTmack9UnyitJ9WRnW-pfkxhfwBBS10cbE4aCFoPnou2484uLqGOLKDspo_Q55lZS0JU-hCVspAzfmkpDzgdPSjs9Xf9zWTAXkAyb1JPKRTrNSugc4btTz1FeDcSk8ZE9NsAX7ujmCARGSImKq1OYoZ1YCXl/mugF96pdtNBPOTUoq3oazIXziVaqN3iK/9>
textAsHtml:
Here are a few resources to help you get started.

Welcome to MongoDB !

Ready to get your first MongoDB cluster up and running? Start with these four
steps:

* Create cluster
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/deploy-free-tier-cluster/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
* Add IP address to access list
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/security/add-ip-address-to-list/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
* Create a user
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/create-mongodb-user-for-cluster/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
* Connect to cluster
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/connect-to-your-cluster/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>

 

We’ve also put together a six-minute video
<https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
that guides you through cluster setup.

<https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>

Next, start building by adding data to your newly created cluster. Use one of
our sample datasets for quick prototyping,generate mock data
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/synthetic-data?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
, orimport your own data
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/import?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
to get started.

Get started
<https://account.mongodb.com/account/login?n=https%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fgo%3Fl%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fv2%2F%3Cproject%3E%26h%3Dclusters%2Fdetail%2F%3Ccluster%3E>

New to MongoDB?

If you’re experienced with relational databases, transitioning to MongoDB’s
document model may feel like a shift—but it’s one designed for flexibility and
performance at scale.

Once you've completed the above steps to get started, review our SQL to
MongoDB mapping chart
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/sql-comparison/?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
to see how common relational concepts translate to MongoDB (e.g. tables →
collections). Then, exploreMongoDB Skills
<https://learn.mongodb.com/skills?utm_campaign=em_gfo_welcome_series_24_10_03&utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=email>
for short, 60–90 minute mini-courses to quickly build your knowledge.

<https://www.linkedin.com/company/mongodbinc/> <https://twitter.com/mongodb>
<https://youtube.com/user/mongodb> <https://www.instagram.com/mongodb>
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/>

subject: Hi there, welcome to MongoDB! Let’s get started.
